channel.title: Sap.py
channel.description: A husband and wife talk about the wife's experience learning Python. Who says programming can't be romantic?
channel.generator: Feeder 3 3.1.6(2632); Mac OS X Version 10.11.3 (Build 15D21) http://reinventedsoftware.com/feeder/
channel.itunes:author: Chris and Jaimie Krycho
channel.itunes:subtitle: Who says programming can’t be romantic?

item.title: 2: The World Needs More Female Programmers
item.description:
Classes and inheritance, making a game, and sticking with it

We catch up on what Jaimie has (and sometimes hasn’t) been doing since October.

  • Learning about classes and inheritance
  • Having a hard time with self
  • Building a small role-playing game (and slaying some dragons along the way!)
  • Dealing with discouragement and the challenge of learning in limited amounts of time (with small children to take care of)
  • The value of support and having a physically-present person available to help when you get stuck
item.itunes:author: Chris and Jaimie Krycho
item.itunes:summary:
Classes and inheritance, making a game, and sticking with it
We catch up on what Jaimie has (and sometimes hasn’t) been doing since October.
Classes and inheritance, making a game, and sticking with it
* Learning about classes and inheritance
* Having a hard time with self
* Building a small role-playing game (and slaying some dragons along the way!)
* Dealing with discouragement and the challenge of learning in limited amounts of time (with small children to take care of)
* The value of support and having a physically-present person available to help when you get stuck

item.title: 1: Mommy, I Have a Function For You!
item.description:
Jaimie continues her journey into the land of Python on Treehouse. A few of the highlights:

  • Fun times with infinite loops, the command line, and Ctrl-C
  • Three-year-olds who pick up on the things their parents are talking about… sort of.
  • How there aren’t necessarily right solutions to any given problem in programming.
item.itunes:author: Chris and Jaimie Krycho
item.itunes:subtitle: Infinite loops, three-year-olds, and “right” answers.
item.itunes:summary:
Infinite loops, three-year-olds, and “right” answers.
Jaimie continues her journey into the land of Python on Treehouse. A few of the highlights:

item.title: 0: When Our Daughters Are Sleeping
item.description: We talk about Python, functions, the differences between Codecademy and Treehouse, and why programming is interesting to Jaimie. Also, we come up with a show title, and eventually even a theme song. (Jaimie definitely came up with the actual idea for the theme song. She’s a boss.)
item.itunes:author: Chris Krycho and Jaimie Krycho
item.itunes:subtitle: A little about us, and the beginning of Jaimie's adventures in Python.
item.itunes:summary: A little about us, and the beginning of Jaimie's adventures in Python.
